alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 18 at 3:30AM MDT until May 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN, WESTERN, AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR- RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR-RECORD HEAT, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to southwest winds with single digit humidity, near record hot temperatures, and an unstable airmass will generate widespread critical fire weather conditions Thursday and Friday. The strongest winds are likely to occur along and north of the I-40 corridor both days. Poor overnight humidity recoveries with breezy to windy conditions Thursday night will keep elevated critical conditions going all night in many areas. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Friday morning through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Highlands Thursday and Friday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 10 percent Thursday. 9 to 13 percent Friday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
